intro: Scandix clavata, commonly known as the clustered cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its clustered, small white flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has a hollow, ridged stem and produces small, kidney-shaped fruits. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family, often found in temperate regions.
